喧嘩.definition: hubbub; clamor; to make a racket

喧嘩與騷動.definition: The Sound and the Fury (novel by William Faulkner 威廉·福克納|威廉·福克纳[Wei1 lian2 · Fu2 ke4 na4])

喧賓奪主.definition: lit. the voice of the guest overwhelms that of the host (idiom); fig. a minor player upstages the main attraction; minor details obscure the main point; the sauce is better than the fish

喧騰.definition: to make a tumult; hubbub; uproar
